Create Reports

Source: R/report.R
report.Rd

Create textual reports. See the documentation for your object's class:

  • Dataframes and vectors

  • Correlations and t-tests (htest)

  • ANOVAs

  • (General) Linear models (glm and lm)

  • Mixed models (glmer and lmer)

  • Bayesian models (stanreg and brms)

report(model, ...)

Arguments

model

Object.
...

Arguments passed to or from other methods.

Examples

library(report)

model <- t.test(Sepal.Length ~ Species, data=iris[1:100,])
r <- report(model)

# Text
r
#> The Welch Two Sample t-test suggests that the difference of Sepal.Length by Species (mean in group setosa = 5.01, mean in group versicolor = 5.94) is significant (difference = -0.93, 95% CI [-1.11, -0.75], t(86.54) = -10.52, p < .001) and can be considered as very large (Cohen's d = -2.26).
summary(r)
#> The Welch Two Sample t-test suggests that the difference of Sepal.Length by Species is significant (difference = -0.93, 95% CI [-1.11, -0.75], p < .001, Cohen's d = -2.26).

# Tables
as.data.frame(r)
#> Parameter    |   Group | Mean_Group1 | Mean_Group2 | Difference |      t |    df |    p | CI_low | CI_high |                  Method | Cohens_d
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Sepal.Length | Species |        5.01 |        5.94 |       0.93 | -10.52 | 86.54 | 0.00 |  -1.11 |   -0.75 | Welch Two Sample t-test |    -2.26
summary(as.data.frame(r))  # equivalent to as.table(r)
#>         Parameter     Group    Mean_Group1     Mean_Group2      Difference
